course_title: Sem:Ancient Mediterr/Anatolian Art: Greek Vase Painting at MCCM
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 8Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Complete Topic: Ancient Images, Modern Contexts - Greek Vase Painting at the Carlos)
(Using the Michael C. Carlos Museum's collection of Greek vases, as well as an extensive study collection, this advanced seminar will introduce students to different approaches to the study of Greek vase painting, from traditional connoisseurship to gender theory and semiotics. Students will also learn about modern collecting practices and the controversies surrounding the acquisition, display, and restitution of ancient objects of contested provenance. A discussion-based seminar, a semester-long research project will give students the opportunity to conduct object and provenance research on ancient objects in the museum's collection while developing their college writing skills.
Art History major/minor: Division I
Art History major with Museums Concentration: elective
This is an upper-level, writing-intensive seminar designed for students who have some experience with art history, typically having taken courses at the 200 or 300 level.)
course_description: Advanced seminar with emphasis on critical texts, methods, and techniques of art historical investigation. For art history majors; open to others with permission from the instructor.
sections: Class Nbr: 3761, Section #: 2, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 10a-12:45p, Instructor: Ward/Allen, Status: Open
